snippet: The court’s cases in Kenya focus on postelection violence in 2007-8 that left more than 1,000 people dead.
abstract: Kenyans Paul Gicheru and Philip Kipkoech Bett are accused by International Criminal Court of bribing prosecution witnesses in trials over violence which killed 1,000 people in wake of 2007-8 election.
lead_paragraph: The court’s cases in Kenya focus on postelection violence in 2007-8 that left more than 1,000 people dead.

headline.main: Kenya: International Court Seeks Two Suspected of Bribing Witnesses
headline.print_headline: Africa; Kenya: International Court Seeks Two Suspected of Bribing Witnesses
